item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事美洲
item.description: 早上好。美国股指期货涨跌不一，交易商在等待对美联储利率前景至关重要的就业数据。美国码头工人结束了为期三天的罢工，由于中东紧张局势加剧，石油将创下自 2023 年初以来的最大单周涨幅。【原文：Good morning. US stock futures are mixed as traders await jobs data crucial for the Fed’s rate outlook. US dockworkers end a three-day strike and oil is set for its largest weekly increase since early 2023 as Middle East tension rises. — Morwenna Coniam】

item.title: 爱尔兰监管机构正在审查瑞安航空公司的客户数据处理流程
item.description: 瑞安航空控股公司（Ryanair Holdings Plc）对个人数据的处理将接受爱尔兰数据保护监管机构的审查，因为一些客户投诉该航空公司要求对在第三方订票网站上购买的机票进行额外的身份验证。【原文：Ryanair Holdings Plc’s processing of personal data will be reviewed by Ireland’s data protection regulator after some customers complained about the airline asking for additional identity verification for tickets bought on third-party booking websites.】

item.title: 印度财政部长预计人均收入将增长近一倍
item.description: 印度财政部长尼尔马拉-西塔拉曼（Nirmala Sitharaman）表示，随着经济的持续增长，印度的人均收入将在五年内翻一番，同时她也警告说，现在的全球环境比过去更加严峻。【原文：India’s Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said income per person will almost double in five years time as the economy continues to grow, while warning that the global environment is tougher now than it was in the past.】

item.title: 即使禁令解除，土耳其仍将对小麦进口实施部分限制
item.description: 根据彭博社看到的一份文件，土耳其计划在本月结束为期四个月的禁购令后，继续限制部分小麦进口。【原文：Turkey plans to continue limiting some wheat imports when its four-month ban on purchases ends this month, according to a document seen by Bloomberg.】

item.title: 现代汽车据称将在印度最大 IPO 中寻求 190 亿美元的价值
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士透露，现代汽车公司正在为其印度分公司的首次公开募股寻求 190 亿美元的估值，这可能是该公司在印度最大的一次股票出售。【原文：Hyundai Motor Co. is seeking a valuation of $19 billion for the initial public offering of its India unit, people familiar with the matter said, in what could be the nation’s biggest share sale.】

item.title: 20 年期美国债券的失败交易飙升至创纪录水平
item.description: 20 年期国债再次证明了为什么 20 年期国债已成为美国国债交易商的难题。【原文：The 20-year Treasury bond just drove home yet again why it has become a problematic maturity for traders of US government debt.】

item.title: 成本飙升，欧洲工业将在数年内削减天然气用量
item.description: 欧洲的重工业因最近的能源价格冲击而伤痕累累，很可能在数年内减少天然气的使用，以度过长期的高成本和利润疲软期。【原文：Europe’s heavy industry, scarred by recent energy-price shocks, is likely to curtail gas use for years to weather a prolonged period of high costs and weak profits.】

item.title: 中国太阳能机械公司向印度提供大宗订单
item.description: 中国林顿科技集团是世界上最大的太阳能硅片制造设备制造商之一，该集团称已获得一家印度企业的设备订单，可为一座 10 千兆瓦的太阳能发电厂生产足够的组件。【原文：China’s Linton Technologies Group, one of the world’s largest makers of machinery to build solar wafers, said it secured an order from an Indian business for equipment to produce enough of the components for a 10-gigawatts solar power plant.】

item.title: 全球银行急于重新调整对土耳其降息的呼吁
item.description: 华尔街银行不得不改写他们对土耳其首次降息时间的预测，因为 9 月份的通胀率高于预期。【原文：Wall Street banks are having to rewrite their forecasts for the timing of Turkey’s first interest-rate cut after higher-than-expected inflation prints in September.】

item.title: 美联储大幅减息押注落空，债券交易员转向就业数据
item.description: 随着美联储今年第二次大幅降息的信念开始动摇，债券交易员们开始从周五的劳动力市场报告中寻找美国经济健康状况的线索。【原文：Bond traders are turning to Friday’s labor-market report for clues on the health of the US economy, as conviction about a second big interest-rate cut by the Federal Reserve this year begins to falter.】

item.title: 伊朗油轮本周逃离重要锚地
item.description: 自德黑兰周一向以色列发射导弹以来，在伊朗最大的原油装载设施附近等候的油轮纷纷逃离该地区，全世界都在等待德黑兰的回应。【原文：Oil tankers waiting nearby Iran’s biggest crude-loading facility fled the area in the days since Tehran launched a missile salvo toward Israel on Monday and the world waits to see what the response will be.】

item.title: 美国大选风险推动美元对冲成本升至 18 个月高点
item.description: 随着总统大选的临近，交易员们急于对冲美元的波动。【原文：Traders are rushing to hedge against swings in the US dollar as a presidential election that remains too close to call approaches.】

item.title: 10 月监督期限临近，印度与欧盟展开谈判
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，印度和欧洲监管机构正在进行激烈讨论，以解决有关当地清算所的监督问题，银行被要求在 10 月底的最后期限即将到来之际做出替代安排。【原文：Indian and European regulators are engaged in intense discussions to resolve oversight issues regarding local clearing houses, with banks asked to make alternate arrangements with an end-October deadline approaching, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 中东战争风险上升，伊朗石油悄然卷土重来成为焦点
item.description: 伊朗的石油生产无视美国多年的制裁，几乎恢复到满负荷生产状态；随着与以色列的紧张局势加剧，这一供应潮看起来越来越脆弱。【原文：Iran’s oil production has defied years of US sanctions to return to almost full capacity — a tide of supply that looks increasingly vulnerable as tensions with Israel flare.】

item.title: 欧盟将对中国电动汽车征收最高 45% 的关税
item.description: 据熟悉这一进程的人士称，欧盟周五投票决定对来自中国的电动汽车征收高达 45% 的关税，此举将加剧与中国政府的贸易紧张关系。【原文：The European Union voted on Friday to impose tariffs as high as 45% on electric vehicles from China in a move set to increase trade tensions with Beijing, according to people familiar with the process.】

item.title: 将人工智能应用到每一件产品中的健康科技老板
item.description:
罗伊-雅各布斯（Roy Jakobs）谈重建信任、地缘政治风险对供应链的意义以及人工智能的赚钱之道。【原文：

Roy Jakobs on rebuilding trust, what geopolitical risk means for supply chains and where money can be made in AI.

】

item.title: 美国就业报告公布后，交易员准备迎接更多 S&P 500 指数波动
item.description: 周五的美国非农就业报告将释放出美联储 11 月降息幅度的信号，交易员们正准备迎接更大的波动。【原文：Traders are bracing for extra volatility on Friday following the US payrolls report that will be scoured for signals as to how much the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates in November.】

item.title: 汇丰银行计划转移与 20 亿欧元企业贷款相关的风险
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，汇丰控股公司计划发布一项与约 20 亿欧元（22 亿美元）企业贷款组合相关的重大风险转移计划。【原文：HSBC Holdings Plc plans to issue a significant risk transfer linked to a portfolio of about €2 billion ($2.2 billion) of corporate loans, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国银行预计印度外汇储备将在 2026 年 3 月达到 7450 亿美元
item.description: 据美国银行（Bank of America）称，到 2026 年 3 月，印度的外汇储备将可能增至 7450 亿美元，这将使印度央行拥有更多潜在的火力来影响卢比。【原文：India’s foreign-exchange reserves will likely rise to $745 billion by March 2026, giving the central bank more potential firepower to influence the rupee, according to Bank of America.】

item.title: 泰国大亨旗下的电力和电信公司因控股公司点头同意合并而跃跃欲试
item.description: 泰国亿万富翁沙拉特-拉塔纳瓦迪（Sarath Ratanavadi）旗下的电力和电信公司周五扩大涨幅，因为股东的批准增强了投资者对其合并提案将获得通过的信心。【原文：Thai billionaire Sarath Ratanavadi’s power and telecom companies extended gains on Friday, as shareholders’ approval bolstered investors’ confidence that their proposed merger will go through.】

item.title: 如果就业数据符合预期，美银美林的哈特内特将迎来风险反弹
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp）策略师迈克尔-哈特内特（Michael Hartnett）认为，如果周五公布的美国月度就业报告在预期范围之内，风险资产可能会反弹。【原文：Risk assets are likely to rally if the monthly US jobs report due Friday is within the range of expectations, according to Bank of America Corp. strategist Michael Hartnett.】

item.title: 英国建筑业因斯塔默的预算预案而蓬勃发展
item.description: 一项重要调查显示，英国建筑业在 9 月份以两年半以来最快的速度增长，这为首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）在经历了数周的经济消极情绪之后打了一支强心针。【原文：The UK construction sector grew at its fastest pace in two-and-a-half years in September, a key survey showed in a boost for Prime Minister Keir Starmer after weeks of negative sentiment about the economy.】

item.title: 蒂森克虏伯向法院申请推翻欧盟对塔塔交易的否决而败诉
item.description: 蒂森克虏伯公司（Thyssenkrupp AG）与塔塔钢铁公司（Tata Steel Ltd.）的欧洲钢铁合资企业计划遭到反垄断否决，蒂森克虏伯公司在欧盟法院推翻反垄断否决的诉讼中败诉。【原文：Thyssenkrupp AG lost a European Union court fight to overturn an antitrust veto of its plans for a European steel joint venture with Tata Steel Ltd.】

item.title: 欧洲央行森特诺称目前通胀率非常接近 2
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员马里奥-森特诺（Mario Centeno）表示，欧元区通胀率目前已非常接近欧洲中央银行设定的 2% 的消费价格增长目标。【原文：Euro-area inflation is now very near to the European Central Bank’s 2% target for consumer-price growth, according to Governing Council member Mario Centeno.】

item.title: 关于英特尔持续不断的混乱的更多内容（播客）
item.description: 美国正在大力发展半导体制造业。英特尔是美国最大的半导体制造商。但有一个问题。英特尔一直在努力使其工厂及时、高效地运转起来。那么问题出在哪里，公司能否扭转局面呢？在本期的 "Lots More "节目中，我们将与伯恩斯坦研究公司的斯泰西-拉斯冈（Stacy Rasgon）和彭博新闻社的麦肯齐-霍金斯（Mackenzie Hawkins）讨论英特尔当前的困境和未来的发展。【原文：The US is in the midst of a big effort to bring more semiconductor manufacturing onshore. Intel is the biggest US semiconductor manufacturer. There’s just one problem. Intel has really been struggling to get its fab operations up and running in a timely, efficient manner. So what’s the problem, and can the company turn things around? On this episode of Lots More, we speak to Stacy Rasgon of Bernstein Research and Mackenzie Hawkins of Bloomberg News to discuss the current struggles and future pro】

item.title: 印尼盾疲软可能导致印尼央行推迟降息，印尼债券下跌
item.description: 由于印尼盾走软增加了印尼央行暂停降息的风险，印尼债券创下近四个月来最大跌幅。【原文：Indonesian bonds fell by the most in almost four months as a weakening rupiah raised the risk the nation’s central bank may pause on interest-rate cuts.】

item.title: 斯里兰卡新领导人在首次国际货币基金组织会议上呼吁减税
item.description: 斯里兰卡新总统在上任后与国际货币基金组织官员的首次会晤中坚持了他的竞选承诺，即减少税收并为公民提供其他救济。【原文：Sri Lanka’s new president stuck to his campaign promises of reducing taxes and providing other relief to citizens in his first meeting with officials from the International Monetary Fund since taking office.】

item.title: 新兴市场债券关注薪资数据寻求新动力
item.description: 新兴市场美元债券的反弹正在等待下一个催化剂，周五晚些时候公布的美国非农就业数据可能会带来这一催化剂。【原文：The rally in emerging-market dollar bonds is awaiting its next catalyst, which may arrive with the US non-farm payrolls data due later Friday.】

item.title: 施普林格-自然在法兰克福首次公开募股中获利，为欧洲首次公开募股赢得胜利
item.description: 施普林格-自然股份公司（Springer Nature AG & Co.【原文：Shares in Springer Nature AG & Co. rose as much as 9.6% on their debut in Frankfurt, delivering a much-needed win for Europe’s equity capital markets.】
